Author: artik123#2884
Content: I'm not sure you're following me... "whatever any collateral gained value, bank will sell everything at a stupid price to get their money."  - if you have money (saving account as collateral) and it gained value but you didn't have the money to repay the loan what happens? They liquidate it (for the sum of the loan plus interest plus fines whatever) and send you the rest... it's very simple

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I don't think that there is interest here, just a kind of fee at liquidation as I read.

Author: artik123#2884
Content: The interest is irrelevant... I'm talking about the principle

Author: phm87#7395
Content: but if KMDEUR is increasing, I think that you can have more keur, jl said it somewhere, I'm searching for the message

Content: Yes, but you could never redeem the loan

Author: phm87#7395
Content: you can redeem the loan if you find another way to have some value (euro or KEUR) to do it

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I also read that partial redeem will be possible (not sure if it is possible in this release)

Content: I was specifically talking about the case where you don't have other resources. Please read the discussion

Content: I'm reading but similar subjects were also discussed elsewhere

Content:
for me, jl replied to your question here https://discordapp.com/channels/412898016371015680/455851625915875338/652553834777935872

Author: artik123#2884
Content: Yes. It's true and it's going to be done. But later I wrote a couple of things to sum up my thoughts and the discussion continued with Mylo

Author: phm87#7395
Content: about ``Without a "closing account" option, it could possibly lead to a systemic problem where, over time, more and more loans would never be redeemed and an ever-increasing amount of usdk will be floating around. I'm not sure what the consequences of it will be`` I don't know how to print more KEUR than total existing existing cryptos. We have loads of USDT floating, it still works. In worst case, 100% of KMD (and other cryptos) will be locked in loans. I don't think that we will reach this point

Author: artik123#2884
Content: We won't. I just mentioned a possible systemic problem. Btw, in worst case 80% will be locked :)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: yeah i know but we can change that in the code

Author: phm87#7395
Content: that's why I wrote in worst case

Author: artik123#2884
Content: I will give you something to think about. You were right... in worst case almost 100% of kmd can be locked with existing code

Author: phm87#7395
Content: about the 80% and liquidation, there was something about 5% or 2 times 5% ... and there is slipping when you dump too much coins ... so maybe I am wrong and it can get more bad

Author: artik123#2884
Content: A specific person can always/endlessly take the usdk that he have just got, convert them back to kmd and take another loan... i need to do the math but I think that he can actually lock as much as 3 times his initial kmd

Author: phm87#7395
Content: there is no incentive to do this, maybe he wants to loose/stuck money

Author: artik123#2884
Content: Of course there is... it's some sort of leverage

Author: phm87#7395
Content: no because you diminue the sum you have

Author: phm87#7395
Content: as you said, you can lock 3 times the initial kmd sum ... then ... you are stuck, you won nothing, you lost/stuck money

Author: artik123#2884
Content: Not true. Think about it. I must go to sleep now

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Have a nice sleep

Author: artik123#2884
Content: üò¥

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
Let's do the math !
if 1 KMD = 1 KEUR
I have 100 KMD, I do a loan then I have 80 KEUR
I convert 80 KEUR to KMD then do another loan, I have 64  ... then 51.2 then 40.96 and so on
Using excel, I did the calculation, it tends to have 0 as output so that's why I think you'll end up with 0
Total sum is around 500 and not 3 times 100

Author: phm87#7395
Content: it is 1:52 AM here, good night buddy

Author: artik123#2884
Content: I didn't do the math... I was just guestimating it... if it's 5 times... then 5 times...more leverage

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: quick math: it's a geometric series with ratio = 0.8 so the sum will be = 100 x 1/(1-0.8) = 500

Author: phm87#7395
Content: the sum of all KMD locked is 500 but the amount you actually have is 0 at the end of all the small loans

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: But then a 4% move and your loan would be called in.....no risk of it not closing.
